column2: U.S. Ambassador Baucus says China hacking threatens national security BEIJING
column3: June 25 Cyber theft of trade secrets by China is a threat to U.S. national security
column4: U.S. Ambassador to China Max Baucus said on Wednesday in the first major public address of his tenure
column5: warning that Washington would continue to pressure Beijing.

column2: REFILE-North Carolina lawmakers order coal ash pond cleanup after Duke spill RALEIGH
column3: N.C.
column4: June 25 North Carolina's state Senate on Wednesday unanimously approved a bill calling for the closure of Duke Energy's 33 coal ash ponds in the state within 15 years
column5: legislation spurred by a massive spill at a retired power plant earlier this year.

column2: Oculus denies claims by ZeniMax in virtual reality tech lawsuit SAN FRANCISCO
column3: June 25 Virtual-reality technology startup Oculus VR denied allegations by videogame publisher ZeniMax Media Inc that it stole trade secrets during development of a gaming headset in a response filed in a federal court on Wednesday.

column2: Ford tells owners to park 2014 F-150 trucks for steering issue DETROIT
column3: June 25 Ford Motor Co has told owners of its top-selling current model 2014 F-150 pickup trucks to park them until a power steering issue affecting 5
column4: 675 of the vehicles is fixed
column5: the company said on its website on Tuesday.

column2: U.S. fast-food chain Del Taco explores sale -sources NEW YORK U.S. fast-food chain Del Taco
column3: which specializes in Mexican cuisine as well as American favorites like burgers and fries
column4: is in the early stages of exploring a sale that could fetch more than $500 million
column5: people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column2: Intel buys into New Zealand sports technology developer WELLINGTON
column3: June 26 U.S. chipmaker and technology company Intel Corp said on Thursday it has invested in a New Zealand company producing software for use in sports and exercise sectors.

column2: Publicis CEO says Omnicom merger flop to cost 40-50 mln euros PARIS
column3: June 25 Publicis CEO Maurice Levy said on Wednesday that the failure of an advertising industry merger with U.S. group Omnicom would cost his company 40-50 million euros.

column2: UPDATE 1-Refiners' shares fall after U.S. allows some light crude exports June 25 Shares of U.S. refiners such as Valero Energy Corp dropped on fears of a rise in crude costs after U.S. officials allowed energy companies to export very light crude oil
column3: or condensate
column4: after it has been minimally processed.

column2: Regions Financial to pay $51 mln for alleged accounting misdeed June 25 Regions Financial Corp
column3: a large U.S. southeast regional bank
column4: agreed to pay $51 million to settle federal and state allegations it failed to account properly for souring commercial loans during the financial crisis

column2: Whole Foods to pay $800
column3: 000 for overcharging California customers June 24 Whole Foods Markets Inc has agreed to pay $800
column4: 000 after an investigation found that the supermarket chain overcharged customers in California
column5: officials in the state said on Tuesday.
